snippet: More than a year after Congress forswore earmarks, local communities that relied on federal money for legitimate needs say they are facing a harsh budget reality.
abstract: More than a year after Congress forswore earmarks, local communities that relied on federal money for legitimate needs say they are facing a harsh budget reality; across the country, dozens of small local governments say they are using the few dollars they have to increase their Washington lobbying efforts to try to compete against bigger and better financed localities for federal grants.
lead_paragraph: More than a year after Congress forswore earmarks, local communities that relied on federal money for legitimate needs say they are facing a harsh budget reality.

headline.seo: In the Post-Earmarks Era, Small Cities Struggle for Federal Grants
headline.main: In Post-Earmark Era, Small Cities Step Up Lobbying to Fight for Federal Grants
